The Gondola at Heavenly.name: The Gondola at Heavenly
reviews:
The gondola to the top is a really scenic trip. Get off at the first stop and observe the many majestic views of the mountains and lake. Lake Tahoe is a sight to be seen, but you can't really see it from the very top of the gondola ride. There is a little gift shop there with relatively good prices. At the very top you can see some of the runs of Heavenly and enjoy the Tammarak lodge. The price is kinda high for food and drinks at this lodge, but much what you would expect at a ski resort. The Gondola is free with the usual lift ticket on skiing and $48 without the ticket. Seniors and kids have cheaper prices and you might find special pricing at some places. We already had lift tickets and were given comp tickets for a couple of riders. Wish it were a little cheaper!!
Show less

I wish there was a cheaper option to ride the gondola when not planning to ski. Perhaps during restricted time?We have had guests with us who do not ski and $30 bucks to ride up and down one time is ridiculous. For skiers the gondola moves fast and is a dream way to access all that Heavenly has to offer
Show less
Whilst it is an expensive prospect there is nothing like the view you can get from the mid way stop. I would not suggest using the food court at the top

I cannot believe the price I was changed for lift passes. I was in tears and wanted to come home. I am now making sure everyone knows just how much I paid, thank you so much for making my trip such a disaster. My 14 year old daughter will never forget seeing her Mum cry!
Show less

The Heavenly Gondola is outrageously priced!
The Heavenly Gondola is inconvenient - no parking nearby, info staff not helpful and lines are too long.
The Heavenly Gondola is unpredictable - never know if it will be running or not due to maintenance or wind/weather holds.
The views are fabulous but the windows are scratched and not clean so photos are not an option.
I would never suggest this as an activity in Tahoe - if you want a good view - hike in the VanSickle Park - great views, cheaper and less stress!
Show less

There's a long wait during touristy times but staff are friendly and helpful. The ride takes you to the observation deck where you have great views of the lake with informational plaques. You hop back on from there to go to the snow activity area for skiing, snowboarding, tubing, ropes course, and more, where the vibe is fun with live DJ music.
Show less

At the peak of the season it will cost you (adult) $64 just to ride the gondola. While I think the ride is amazing and a Tahoe must-do, I'm giving it four stars because of the price-to-value ratio. The views of Lake Tahoe are unmatched and the ride up and down are both fun, but it's hard to give this attractions five stars because of the steep price (pun intended).

I recommend arriving early (we arrived at 8:00 am) for easy parking (use the lot behind the grocery store - $20 for the whole day) and getting your tickets ASAP. The resort gets crazy crowded around 11am and when we were leaving at 12:00 pm, the line was outrageous!
Show less

We got our ski lift passes through Epic on line and decided to use the gondola as our access to the slopes. Beautiful breath taking views of Lake Tahoe and surrounding countryside. It’s enclosed and keeps the wind and weather off.
I’ve skied for 30 years & a variety of places, Heavenly’s gondola is most efficient. A team of four rotate getting skis & forming a group for each enclosed car. Moves fast & easy!
We were there during summer. It was a bit pricey to go up the gondola, but it did provide an excellent view of the Lake, so it was worth it.

Season pass holder, take gondola up to the mountain to snowboard. This is a very peaceful perch of my snowboarding experience as I get 25 minutes of Amazing views and good conversation with my friends and family that I am snowboarding with.
The view was so worth the price. Be sure and get off at the 1st stop for the most amazing views. We paid $58 per adult, but would do it again.

Basically, this is the way to get to the Heavenly Ski Resort on top of the mountain and like everything else at Heavenly, it's super expensive. Kind of like a theme park. But once the sticker shock subsides, you can enjoy the incredible view of the lake and far off mountains. A bit of a zoo in the morning as everyone scrambles to buy tickets. There is a dedicated window for gondola tickets that doesn't include lift tickets - this line moves very fast. This is what we did the first day, since we were only interested in tubing once we got to the top (tubing is not included with a lift ticket - it is its own thing - a lot of fun, btw!). This can be a little confusing. Anyhow, the gondola is quite a feat in engineering and the highlight of our trip.
Show less
Expensive but worth it if you love views!
Riding the gondola to the top of the mountain was really fun. The views are stunning! You get off part way up and can walk around an observation deck.
It’s the most beautiful view of Lake Tahoe. Very worth! On the top there is a bar/restaurant. I didn’t eat there so I can’t help with that!

The Gondola was a little pricey, but well worth it for the view of Lake Tahoe. There are 2 stops that you can get off at before you head back down. The first stop is a must for picture takers. There is a small gift shop at the first stop and bathrooms. There are 2 places also you can get drinks at during the summer. Both places were closed while we were there. We took lots of pics and then got back on the Gondola and road to the top. We stood and watched the skiers and snow boarders. There is a restaurant/bar that has a happy hour and music. We did not walk over to it because it looked like it was all ice getting to it and we were both in tennis shoes. You would probably need a walking stick or spikey shoes that would help you walk over. On the way down to the base, there is no stopping at the overlook to take pictures again, so make sure and do it on your way to the top. There is a parking garage but I am not sure the cost on it. Across the street from the Gondola area there is a shopping area that has a Wyland Gallery in it. There are signs everywhere not to park in that lot or you could be towed. At the back of that parking lot there is a marked off area you can park for $20 for the day. The casino's are within walking distance of the Gondola area.
Show less
Heavenly Gondola was expensive I will agree with that and it was a short little ride but the views of Lake Tahoe are exquisite!

The Gondola itself was nice but for skiers the location was horrible. The Gondola drop off for skiers starts with a bunch of steps to get down to the snow and then it’s a hike to get to the first series of ski lifts. Not sure why they placed the Gondola so far away from the lifts and they could have had the stop a little earlier so that it was level with the area by the lifts and lodge. Plus, having to hike up those stairs after a long day of skiing isn’t fun. First ski Gondola I have been to where the location was so poorly located.
Show less

We love to ski Heavenly and one of our favorite parts is the ride up the gondola. It takes about 15 minutes and offers the most panaoramic views of the lake you will ever see. I appreciate the fact that there are ski and snowboard storage bins attached to the outside of the gondola cars, which keep bulky, awkward equipment out of the way so you can focus on unobstructed views. The gondola attendants are super friendly and load your skis for you.
Show less

While the price of the gondola ticket may seem crazy expensive for a 15 - 20 minute ride up the mountain and another 15 - 20 minute back down, it is totally worth it. They max out each Gondola to 8 people at the most and it is so beautiful to see the scenery around town. We took beautiful family pictures in the gondola itself as well as at the Observation Platform halfway up. Seriously, do NOT miss this stop on the way up. You will not stop here on the way down. They have picnic tables set up here so you can have a quick snack while you take it all in. They also have free standing binoculars available for use around the deck. It's a smooth ride and enjoyed by all in my family.
Show less

It's a pricey ride but probably worth it. The views of the mountains and the Lake are amazing. Snow, blue sky, green pines. Wow. We had a beer and rode all the way up to the top on the second lift. Very nice.

Located conveniently next to hotels however if you are just visiting there is no parking. Used to be able to park at local hotels but they have cracked down on it. Lines get long for lift tickets so make sure you come early or buy prior to getting there! Views are gorgeous from this resort! Skiing is awesome, lots of runs, more flat areas than I like and mountain is definitely more for skiiers but overall I love heavenly!
Show less
We got there for 9am waited for 5 mins and were straight on. Staff are really nice and put our skis on the rack for us . Quick ride up with amazing views !
Very picturesque but inconvenience for skiing

The gondola itself as a tourist attraction is very beautiful. The views of the lake and mountains are spectacular. This is not the purpose my family and I were using the gondola for however. As the main transportation up the mountain for skiiers from heavenly village, I found that the exit point at the top of gondola was an inconvenience for skiiers and boarders due to the stairs you must climb down as well as the fact you must either walk or skate to the tamarack lift (a fair distance) OR skate even further on a flat to access the Californian lifts.
Show less

As family visiting heavenly on a skiing trip, utilising the gondola was our quickest and easiest way to access the slopes, we were not prepared for the magnificent views it provided over the Lake Tahoe area, showing the lake and surrounding mountain ranges. It also provides easy access for foot travellers and a viewing platform half way up for those who want take in the spectacular view in the open air. The only issue I found as a skier was the stairs that had to be negotiated at the top and the fact that you had to travel uphill to access the ski lifts.
Show less
Bad design for skiers at the top...

Our accommodation was right beside the Gondola so this became our morning ride to Ski Heavenly. Strange how for a ski lift though that the Gondola lands you smack bang in the middle of beginner/tourist walker land, and even stranger that you have to either skate uphill to the Tamarack lift or another uphill skate across to the California trail....If the Gondola went 20 or 30 metres further all of this would be alleviated and hence so would the congestion at the base of the stairs. Also the many stairs and ski boots simply don't mix at the end of a very long day on the slopes. I witnessed many slips and falls over the 8 days. I believe the non skier trade must have influenced this weird engineering decision? The Gondola ride itself though is something to experience as the views over the lake are breathtaking indeed as is the gradient to get to the top.
Show less
Over priced and no information absolute rip off

What a let down, we paid a little over $500 for 2 days use of the Gondola and this was not to ski or board this was purely just use of the Gondola. what they don't tell you is if you buy your tickets daily after 1pm they are half price we felt ripped off after we found this information out,,,, the windows on all the carriages are damaged and scratched which means no good photographs as you go up, staff a rude and arrogant, typical of a monopoly mountain ski area, they will sell you tickets to an attraction at the top of the mountain even if that attraction is closed. and then make excuses, day 2 we went up to use the tubing for my daughter and they where closed, the response we got got verbatim" We are a Ski and Board Resort, Other Activities are a Bonus"
Never Again.
Show less
Sold out on Sunday but luckily we were leaving Monday. So got a chance to ride the gondola up just for sightseeing. Friendly staff and great ride up!

We visited Lake Tahoe over the Christmas period. There had been fresh snow a couple of days before we arrived, but there was plenty at the top of the mountain. We missed out on our first day getting to the top, as they only sell so many sightseeing tickets per day, so if it is a busy time I suggest you get there early on the day you wish to travel on the Gondola to secure your tickets as the lines can be quite long. Once you have your ticket you can ride at anytime during that day. The views are amazing. You can stop on the way up to take photos of the lake from the observation deck. You can only do this on the way up. If you are in the area even if you are not skiing it is worth the trip to the top.

amazing ride up the mountain. went from 50 and sunny at the base to a blizzard on top. one world to another fairly quickly
Don't Miss Out, even if you don't Ski!

We decided to take a ride on the Gondola after we were done skiing for the day. We are so glad we did! We took the Gondola to the Observation Deck. When we got out we were so impressed with the view of Lake Tahoe from there!
Show less

We went to Tahoe during a time of not too much snow so the gondola was a pricey but worth it experience for us. We got to see snow up close in the mountains. I don't ski but still had fun traveling, seeing snow, and eating at the restaurant they had for happy hour and the nachos.
Show less
Best ski trip, so good we named our son after this place

Heavenly Ski Resort is a touch of paradise in Lake Tahoe. Huge terrain, quality snow, friendly and very helpful staff, and a massive layout. Good for intermediate to experienced skiers with long runs and quick chairs. The Gondola to the top is a worthy experience. So good that our sons middle name is Tahoe and our daughters middle name is Snow. Could easily move here!
Show less
Great views of the lake. Efficient to get to the ski slopes. Warm and comfortable. Operators are friendly and good. Service runs as much as the slopes are available for skiing. Good gondola to take.

Not much snow at the Lake, but quite a bit at the top. I didn't mind paying the $55 round trip to the top, but the $6 for a bottle of Pepsi at the observation deck is a bit much... Beautiful view, but the windows all being scratched up was a disappointment
Show less

A great great view. If you are only looking for views, get out at observation deck on the way ‘up’ (it does not stop at observation deck on way ‘down’). If you are a skier/boarder who is not a beginner, this is a slow way to get to the best terrain, drive to Stagecoach or Calif Base Lodge instead
Show less
Great way to get to the snow the fastest when you can get curb drop off. Not worth parking as the plaza charges for parking. This is a shame especially when they charge $150 for the lift tickets.

Awesome view of the Lake Tahoe.
Nice ride and great opportunity for taking great shots on the observation deck. It's optional and I strongly recommend it. On upper, last station there are nice areas but not as beautiful as the view of the lake from the deck. There is a restaurant on the top and the tubing for kids during the winter.
The only bad thing is the price for the ride for people who not even use the ski trails.
For me and my teenager son I had to pay $109 !!!
It's robbery..... :(

The view is great, but if you are not sking , not much to do at the top. This is a pricey trip to go once. If you plan to ski it's good. The view is beautiful and you do not have to wait long.
Pricey but only way to get the view!

Not sure of any other way to get to the top of the mountain. We don't ski but wanted to see the snow and view. Staff was great. Long lines but then it was New Years and expected. Be sure you stop at the observation deck before going on to the top. It doesn't stop on the way down. Very very pricey but we expected this beforehand. It's a ski resort, in CA, of course it is going to cost a lot. But since this was a one-time trip, we thought it was worth it. Spectacular view I'm not sure you could get anywhere else.

The Gondola has very helpful staff, you can load the skies on the outside. The only bad thing is that the glass on the cars are scratched.
The gondola ride (views) was breathtaking and I highly recommend. There was snow for the little ones to play in, even though the temps were in the 50s down in the village. We had a great time.
Go enjoy yourself out on the mountain, drink a nice IPA. The atmosphere of Heavenly Village is quaint. Enjoy the wonderful view & staff.
Was skiing with family. Non skiers wanted to join us on the mountain for lunch & for kids to go tubing. Return trip is $50 for adult, $35 four kids. Just silly money & simply not worth it.

I can appreciate that if money is tight that this is expensive, but as a tourist I felt it was well worth the price. I don't see what all the fuss about price is from other reviewers unless they are on a truly tight budget. The gondola was well maintained and the staff was attentive-what you want when you are going up the side of a mountain, correct? I was actually a bit nervous on our ascent, but was comforted as everything looked top notch in terms of maintenance of the gondolas and all of the mechanics. The views were excellent.

Although it is expensive, $64 for one trip, it was worth it for the views. Accompanied grown children who were on gondola as part of lift ticket to go skiing, I was not skiing. It stops at observation deck, halfway up, beautiful views of lake and surrounding mountains, it was extraordinarily windy the day I visited, but was great vantage point. Then climbed back on went to top of mountain, you can go to lodge, etc. Nice thing is going back down at non peak time you can get your own gondola and thus wonderful photos.

Loved our trip up and down

Was told the day we got there that if we wanted a pass up and do the tubbing we had to get to the office right when they open because they have been selling out early , so I got up the next morning at 7 ate breakfast walked over there from my hotel and was there at 0800 to make sure I can get three tickets up we had our own Gondola which was nice so we could take picture , nice sights of all of Lake Tahoe .
Show less
Nice place to ski and snowboarding. They have private classes also. There’s restaurant and clean bathroom.

20 minute ride in each direction to get to the ski mountain. Stop at observation deck, about mid-way for excellent picture taking location. Not much to do at the top other than eat (also expense) and look around

A bit expensive, but worth going at least once. Nice views from the observation deck mid way. Gondola ride is comfortable and many activities to do at the top. A nice way to spend the day in fresh and healthy manner.
Wanted to go, but not at these prices

We didn’t ski because there was so little snow, but we wanted to go up for the view and lunch. I have been up the mountain before, and the views are phenomenal from the top, but there is no way in the world i am going to pay 64 dollars a person for the sightseeing gondola. That is 256 dollars for a family of four. That is highway robbery! Sorry!!!
Show less

Took the gondola up with another family with small kids. Short queue for tickets. Good that kids under 5 are free. Then went round to board and we got our own gondola. Stopped at viewing point for quick walk around and then headed up to the top to find snow! Well run, clean and simple.
Show less

The views are gorgeous, the staff was helpful and friendly, everything ran very smoothly. The lines can be insane with all the skiers. Marriott Concierge helped us get tickets without the line and for the next day. Tubing tickets only sell a set amount for the day. The price of admission is worth the experience, especially if you don’t live near or often visit ski resorts.
Show less

We are not skiers, however, we highly recommend a ride on the Heavenly Gondola. Take a camera—the first stop is a huge sight seeing deck. The view of Lake Tahoe is breathtaking—we’ve been there winter and summer. Always spectacular!
The gondola was a great trip up to Heavenly. Great views at the first stop and a nice ride over to the ski resort. A little pricey, but the trip and views are worth it.

This is a comfortable way to get to the top from Heavenly Village. But it’s not cheap - $64 for adult and $35 for kids (below 12) during peak period. That covers only one trip up and down.

Journey itself is quite smooth with gorgeous views up the mountain and down over the lake. There is a stop for the observation deck about 3/4 of the way up - you have to get off on the journey up if you want to stop there.

The entire journey to the top is about 20 minutes. Most traffic at the top during winter season is of skiers/ snowboarders so keep that in mind. There are some trails to walk around but lots of foot traffic during the holidays.
Show less

Many improvements this year on the gondola trip. More activities added to the mountain. Much more for kids, only one worker was a stick in the mud. Everyone else was friendly & nice! Still snow so winter activities were available. Definitely a must see every time we visit.
Show less
This is the most convenient ski lift we have been on - a little expensive but they have got the market

First and last trip to Heavenly Gondola! The biggest mistake I've made is that I didn't read the RECENT reviews before coming here.

First of all, even if you reserved your ticket online, which was about $129, you still had to wait 2 hours to retrieve it and finally get on the gondola. The lines were insanely long and unorganized. It didn't help that the ushers were giving wrong information as to where to line up.

Second, although I liked the view at the observation deck, the experience went downhill from there. As we got on the skiing side of the mountain, we asked employees of the resort for help, and they were incredibly rude and mean. I fell my first near a slope and this Heavenly employee (operated the lift) told me it was my fault for falling and continued to berate me as I got hit by another skier (and apologized to him). I'm sorry I'm not experienced since this was my first time skiing. Heck, this is the first place I came to see snow. It didn't stop there as several employees were horribly degrading us, as we asked for simple stuff. I remember asking one employee (helping out at the tubing area) if he could take a picture of my family and he yelled and rudely told us off that he was working and he didn't have time to deal with guests.

Seriously, it's like the employees of this resorts hate international guests. It's like they're nice to locals and regulars in one moment, and then when it's people like us, who are new and curious to the place, they shun us and over exaggerate our faults.

The locals and other guests were so kind to help us (like preventing us from getting lost and simply lending a hand), but the employees are just so discouraging. Don't get me wrong, there are a FEW employees who are kind (these are the instructors), but the employees who are doing minimal work (like standing around the lift, activity places, entrance) are one of the worst customer service I've ever received.

Finally, that experience wasn't worth the price! Everything was expensive. Expect to spend about $500 for 2 people in 1 day. I would've been fine with spending that amount, but most of the employees are ridiciously the worst people.

If you're a visitor from another place/ country, don't come here. You'll be treated as an outsider, taken advantage, and discouraged from even trying to ski/snowboard again
Show less
For 1 trip to the top no skiing. $55 is outrageous. Its a nice photo opportunity. Is it worth the line up and crowds????
Go to Squaw Valley and ride the tram instead
Though the scenery is okay the price is a rip off. You can ride the Squaw Valley Tram and Funitel all day for the same price that Heavenly charges and there is much more to see.

If they had decent prices for family it would be outstanding. I feel for poor people that can not afford this experience.
Plus the parking situation is ridiculous. Parking near the gondola is non existent. Lake Tahie turning into a rich mans town. So sad and disappointing.
Show less

$55 per person for a ride to the top of the mountain and then gouging prices once you get there - not sure I would do it again... We thought it would be fun to get lunch at the top, but the cafeteria style burger platter was $26 -- that's just throwing good money after bad! The cost of the ride up should be deducted from what you spend at the top (similar to how skiing is handled) so as long as you spend $55 or more, your ride up is free!!!

Be sure to get off at the halfway point for some very good views/photos if you do decide to spend the money! ALSO - buy your souvenirs at the halfway stop because they don't have any at the top (at least not in the primary lodge.)
Show less

Visit this venue on the 19th Dec 2017, $56 per person if you only want for sightseeing which will carry you to the top. There are 2 stops, 1 for sightseeing/viewing purposes, and the second one for skiing and of course for a bit of photos as well.

The wind was chilling around 10am, and when we stopped at the 1st stop, it was very windy and quite difficult to take photos. We have to shelter a while at the gift shop. When we continue to the second stop, the clerk do not allow us to alight cause they said they discontinuing the service to the bad weather, so we were sent back down immediately, although it really took us a while to realize that on the opposing gondola there were lots of people coming up. When we were down, we asked and the clerk said that the service has been resumed, to our disappointment. Anyway this is why you should check the weather report first.
Show less
Amazing views! Me and my boyfriend went this past weekend. It was quick, no line. Was able to take amazing pictures. We went to ski lodge at the top and enjoyed a beer before riding back down.
Enjoy the snow and have fun!!
Fresh mountain air and fabulous snow views. They also provide skiing classes here, and they do have easy and slow ride to the higher area.

We are not skiers but wanted to see up the mountain. As we stay at the Timber Lodge, the Gondola was right outside the entrance. You do get great views and the ride takes about 20 minutes each way. There is a massive observation deck before you get to the top that you can get off at and look around. Beware though the observation deck is only accessible on the way up. You can get back on and continue to the lodge, walk around and return when you are ready.

My only complaint was the cost. For adults it is $55 each during winter and $20 for kids over 4. Clearly, the gondola is more for skiers and I'm sure built into the lift passes but for sightseers, that's pretty steep. I would say worth the onetime expenditure.
Show less
I only did this for the view which was breathtaking. The price was really steep, but I don't ski so I wasn't really getting my money's worth anyway. I would go early, the lines can sometimes be long
Short wait, easy slow ride to ski area

We rode the Gondola at Heavenly on 11/20 and 11/21 in order to get to the ski resort (both the California and Nevada sides were closed still).

The ride itself was easy (no lines), smooth, and all the operators were nice/friendly. The only downsides were the somewhat long ride and the fees to park in the parking garage. We parked in the parking garage the 1st day and ended up paying around $21. The second day, we found a free lot that was walking distance away instead.
Show less

I was so very disappointed. The Gondola was closed! I checked several sites, Trip Advisor as one of them, and every single place told me it was opened today until 4:30. You can imagine how disappointed we were. We even drove 2 hours just to come ride. It does look fun, just wish the information provided was accurate.
Show less
What an amazing experience. Fabulous views. Fresh mountain air. So pleased we decided to visit the top of the mountain, saw little chipmunks and felt really healthy with the fabulous air.

Our first time ever to South Lake Tahoe. The town was full of people. But the gondola was closed for maintenance. This was a Saturday so it isn't like they schedule their work during the week. This was middle of October so beware if you come this time of year.
Show less
This is expensive but worth it if you're not someone that can hike up a mountain. The views are amazing.

We stay at Tahoe seasons resort at the base of heavenly so this is a great opportunity to take a ride up the mountain and see all the great views of Lake Tahoe and downtown area you can see for miles in all directions. Whether it’s winter our summer reviews are outstanding all the time .
Show less

Planned to ride the gondola one afternoon during our vacation. Got to the ticket office to find a sign that said CLOSED. If you are planning a trip in the near future, please be aware it is closed for maintenance until November. Very disappointed!
We'll worth the cost. The view is fantastic. Definitely get off the 1st stop and do the walkway to see Lake Tahoe. The lodge at the end has the best Bloody Mary but is pricey at over $17.
The ride what can I say of the views enclosed cabs made it much nicer to take pictures. People working the lift where very nice helpful .
Great views but disappointed that everything was closed

The views were fantastic as everyone else notes. We were disappointed that everything at the top was closed due to recent snow including the hiking trails. Our fault for not checking the board near the ticket counter in advance.

Visited Lake Tahoe for a wedding. We decided to take a Gondola ride up the mountain. It was cold but the views were breathtaking. Take a camera and dress for the occasion. We stopped at the top to take in a college football game, drink a beer and enjoy the scenery. It did not disappoint.

My honey and I decided to take it to the top of the mountain. Cold morning for sure... remember to take your gloves and scarf as well as your camera. Breathtaking views. A cup of hot chocolate is just what we needed to get warm. Love the stops and trails along with way. Wrapped up out trip at the lodge watching college football, enjoying a glass of beer and some good chill!

Expensive but worthwhile ride to the top of the ski hill. Over 9,000 feet with a panoramic view of Lake Tahoe and the town below.

The viewing stand at the top of the gondola offers the best view of Lake Tahoe to be found. You can see all the different shades of blue, the sail boats and the surrounding Sierras. Breath taking. The lodge at the top is nice and a meal credit is offered with the ride. Great value.
Show less

My wife and i were referred to this activity by the front desk woman at Postmarc hotel where we stayed while in Tahoe. It was a very smooth calm fun ride up the mountain with amazing views, especially at the top of the mountain. Great time, would recommend it to anyone visiting Tahoe.
Show less
Be Sure to Check Seasonal Hours

We were really excited to take the gondola for a view of Lake Tahoe. I'd called ahead to see how long the gondola ride takes which the woman estimated to take about 25 minutes all together. Problem was, that when we got there everything was closed even though the website said that it opened at 9am. It turns out their seasonal and weekend/weekday hours are not well advertised. They aren't running the gondola Monday-Thursday currently (September). I highly advise that you call ahead and ask their current hours since I had to call twice to figure this out. There is a large sign board right outside Heavenly that shows what's open/closed and hours of operation but that's only convenient if you're there on the premises. I'm sure the views are great, just sorry we missed out on them due to the hours of operation mix up.
Show less

Nice view. Expensive but unique. We had planned for half a day with adventure pacs for the youngsters, but my wife had a nasty fall while walking that required first aid and a trip to the Quick Care facility in Stateline. Nick and his crew of medical staff on the mountain were great. Really took charge and dealt with the situation. We also got full refunds for all our tickets--including the gondola ride--so it turned out to be "not expensive" after all. So, all in all, it was, good and not-so-good. Once my wife got checked out OK at the facility in Stateline we called it a day. I felt bad for the grandkids who missed out on the zip lines, etc., but at least we got great view of Lake Tahoe from the top of the mountain.

Show less

Bit pricey at 45 dollars each and then if you want to take part in any of the activities at the top you need to pay for them but the views are absolutely stunning and would not have missed it for the world.

The gondola ride up the mountain was fabulous. The trip was made even more enjoyable by the friendly and helpful staff who seemed to go out of their way to make the mountain experience something special.

This place is a MUST visit when you're going to South Lake California! One of the most breathtaking view I've seen in my entire life.

TIP:
If you're going to visit during summer, make sure to bring your cap and jacket or scarf, because it's still chilly.

Ziplines and ropes course were a big hit

TripAdvisor really needs to open a new entry for summer activities at Heavenly. Summer options are SO different than winter.

We did the Blue Streak Zipline (the longest one at 3300 feet) and everyone loved it. We had 3 grown ups who were a bit squeamish to try it, but found it was awesome, and two 12-year olds who loved it but felt like it could have gone even faster. (I think because they were lighter, they may have gone slower than the grownups, who thought it was plenty fast). They tell you it can get up to 50 miles per hour at the highest speed, you slow down significantly below that before coming in to "land". You sit in a seat, which makes it feel less frightening than some ziplines. It's a long ride (for a zipline) with lovely views. Really recommend it.

The kids and some of the adults also did the "middle" of three ropes courses. It was was really fun for all, although the adult most afraid of heights was definitely put off by some of the crossing options. It's nice that there are multiple ways to get though the course and you can try different routes. There are three ropes course options -- one for very small kids, a mid-range one that's great for tweens and more conservative adults, and the largest one targeted at adventurous adults.

It's a little complicated to figure out the ticketing structure for the summer activities. There is no "one ticket for all activities" pass. The two longest ziplines must be purchases separately, a set of activities including the ropes courses and a tubing run come as part of a package, and there are two options for a 5 or 7 zipline "canopy tour" that is totally separate. I think they could simplify the ticketing a bit. But we got there at 11am and happily stayed till the activities closed at 4pm. Could easily have arrived earlier and spent the entire day there. Fantastic for our 12 year olds and adults. The younger kids options looked like they would be equally as fun.

One note -- I found the "dry land" tubing a little uncomfortable. You basically are tubing on some kind of astroturf. You go remarkably fast, and the sides of the tubing run feel low. I kept thinking I was going to slide over the edge and scrape myself up. I did not...nor did I see anyone else slide out of the track, so it's likely just my fear. But it felt dicey to me. Looked much less dicey for kids (they weigh less and didn't seem to slide up as high on the sides).

I was definitely a little apprehensive about the long zipline, but I loved it. Give it a try even if you're a little nervous!

There was still snow but most of it had melted off. Go early in the day. It gets warm in the afternoon (especially in the enclosed gondola) and the best view is west so if you go late afternoon you are looking into the sun. Once at the top there is one more (ski lift) ride you can take for free, and both adult and kids zip lines that are fun but not free and can have a long wait. We were lucky as they just opened up the day before (June 16). It’s not cheap as it cost us over $100 for two adults and one child but the views are worth it. The three of us went up in one gondola without a wait, and it looks like it can fix up to six. On the way up you can stop at an observation deck and its well done with many great spots to take pictures and to just sit and soak it in. There are information stations as well. There is a small coffee shop as well, but we skipped it as just basic coffee was $5 and that was the cheapest option I saw. They also do the take your picture and try and sell it to you later for another high price routine as well.

Once you get to the top, there are various activities to do if you choose, such as doing a small zip line for kids. The thing I remember the most is that they have a café and I was shocked when I saw the prices. For example, for only $27 (plus tax) you can get an Italian beef sandwich, fries, and unlimited refills of soda! I know they got you up there, but that is an absolute joke (and I’ve been to many sporting events and concerts so I know about high prices). Oh well, we passed on the food as that wasn’t the point of going up there anyway.

Overall, it was a great experience and is a must do while in South Lake Tahoe.
